title: Density Formula
text: Density is mass per unit volume, and the formula is $$p=\frac{m}{v}$$ where $$p$$ is the density, $$m$$ is the mass, and v is the volume occupied by the substance.

title: Factor of Density Increase Formula
text: Factor of Density $$Increase=\frac{p_f}{p_i}=\frac{\frac{m}{v_f}}{\frac{m}{v_i}}=\frac{v_i}{v_f}$$, where $$p_f$$ is the final density while $$p_i$$ is the initial density.

title: Calculate the Factor of Density Increase
text: Notice that the final volume is $$0.350$$ times the initial volume. What is $$\frac{1}{0.35}$$? (keep two decimal places)
